content:
jworks said
In TB under Help, About TB it says I have ver.115.3.2 . Does this mean Thunderbird has already updated to Supernova?
    • I forgot to mention, it says (32 bit) and has the word "Supernova" under that. It also says TB is up to date.
creator: jworks

content: Tell us what settings you are using. Just to be clear, Thunderbird is not an email server; it is an email client, which handles the other end of email server communications.
creator: davidsk

content:
Per quel che vedo non hai aggiornato il metodo di autenticazione ad OAuth2 come richiesto da Microsoft -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/autenticazione-oauth-microsoft-thunderbird-2023

Per Gufo, devi rivolgerti al suo sviluppatore.
creator: @next

content: This is the tech support forum. We appreciate your desire to donate, and the place to address this is at this URL: https://www.thunderbird.net/da/donate/help/ Again, thank you for your interest.
creator: davidsk

content: Kullandığım beta sürümünde böyle bir problem olmadığını gördüm. https://www.thunderbird.net/tr/download/beta/ adresinden betayı indirip deneyebilir veya problemin giderilmesi için yeni sürümün çıkmasını bekleyebilirsiniz.
creator: maxcoder

content: I suggest you contact OWL for support first, as they are a separate organization.
creator: davidsk

content:
david said
There is a three dot menu just to right of the New Message button with that option. If you are not seeing that, click view>folders>folder pane header.

You have helped me, thanks! Is there any other way to get this feature?
creator: solarscream88

content: There is a three dot menu just to right of the New Message button with that option. If you are not seeing that, click view>folders>folder pane header.
creator: davidsk

content:

content:
Yes, I also found that Thunderbird 115.3.2 does NOT work but 115.3.1 does work with OWL 1.2.2. You can downgrade Thunderbird on Ubuntu 22.04 with this deb.

http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/main/t/thunderbird/thunderbird_115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.2_amd64.deb
creator: Olness
